meanings.definition: Making or causing a rapid succession of short, sharp sounds
meanings.sent1: The rattling noise of the train passing by was loud.
meanings.sent2: The old windows made a rattling sound in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The rattling noise of the pots and pans falling made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The rattling sound of the hail hitting the roof was like a drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The rattling noise of the keys jingling was unmistakable.

meanings.sent1: Her rattling speech captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: The team put on a rattling performance that amazed everyone.
meanings.sent3: The rattling fireworks display lit up the night sky beautifully.
meanings.sent4: His rattling skills on the guitar left everyone in awe.
meanings.sent5: The rattling magic trick left everyone wondering how it was done.

meanings.definition: To shake or cause to shake with a rapid succession of short, sharp sounds
meanings.sent1: She was rattling the jar to mix the ingredients.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake rattled the windows in their frames.
meanings.sent3: He rattled the tambourine to keep the beat of the song.
meanings.sent4: The thunder rattled the windows and made the dog bark.
meanings.sent5: The wind rattled the leaves on the trees, creating a soothing sound.
